articles.title: Earth's 'pulse' of geologic activity happens every 27.5 million years, says study - Daily Mail
articles.description: Strangely, global geologic events over the last 260 million years have been grouped in 'pulses' of roughly 27.5 million years apart, say researchers at New York University.
articles.content:
Catastrophic events on Earth don't come at random, but are dictated by a 'pulse' of geologic activity that occurs every 27.5 million years, a new study reveals.
